translated: It is like gold, because the intention for the six perfections never changes.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhicitta of superior intention, like the waxing moon, is to be learned from the Mother, with the wish to complete the applications of mindfulness up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha by way of non-observation.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rdzogs par gong nas gong du 'phel bas zla ba tshes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rdzogs par gong nas gong du 'phel bas zla ba tshes pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the waxing moon because the roots of virtue increase more and more.

original: sbyor ba me lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa dang / lam rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / gzhi thams cad shes par 'dod pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba me lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pa dang / lam rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / gzhi thams cad shes par 'dod pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba yongs su spang bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhicitta of application, like fire, is to be learned from the Mother, with the wish to attain the knowledge of all aspects, with the wish to complete the path, with the wish to know all bases, and with the wish to abandon the connections of habitual tendencies.

original: mkhyen pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bud shing bsregs pas me lta bu'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bud shing bsregs pas me lta bu'o //
translated: It is like fire because it burns the firewood of the counteragents to the three knowledges.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gter lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni ser sna can rnams sbyin pa la 'god par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug zil gyis mnan par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gter lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni ser sna can rnams sbyin pa la 'god par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa drug zil gyis mnan par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The spirit of enlightenment, which is the perfection of generosity, is like a treasure. Those who wish to establish the miserly in generosity and to surpass the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas in the six perfections should train in the Mother.

original: sbyin pa mi zad pa gter chen po lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi zad pa gter chen po lta bu'o //
translated: Generosity is like an inexhaustible great treasure.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i 'byung khungs bzang po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams tshul khrims la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rin po che'i 'byung khungs bzang po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams tshul khrims la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The spirit of enlightenment, which is the perfection of morality, is like an excellent mine of jewels. Those who wish to establish the immoral in morality should train in the Mother.

original: mngon mtho dang nges legs tshul khrims las 'byung bas rin po che'i 'byung khungs bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon mtho dang nges legs tshul khrims las 'byung bas rin po che'i 'byung khungs bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: Since high status and definite goodness arise from morality, it is like an excellent mine of jewels.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni sems 'khrugs pa rnams bzod pa la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rgya mtsho lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni sems 'khrugs pa rnams bzod pa la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The ocean-like perfection of patience of the Thought of Enlightenment is to be learned by the Mother, by one who desires to establish the disturbed in patience.

original: bzod pa de zab pas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de zab pas rgya mtsho lta bu'o //
translated: That perfection of patience is like an ocean because of its profundity.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni le lo can rnams brtson 'grus la dgod par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni le lo can rnams brtson 'grus la dgod par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The diamond-like perfection of perseverance of the Thought of Enlightenment is to be learned by the Mother, by one who desires to establish the lazy in perseverance.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la mi dge bas dbye bar mi nus pas rdo rje pha lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la mi dge bas dbye bar mi nus pas rdo rje pha lam lta bu'o //
translated: That perfection of perseverance is like a diamond because it cannot be split by non-virtue.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ri'i rgyal po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni sems g-yeng ba rnams bsam gtan la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ri'i rgyal po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni sems g-yeng ba rnams bsam gtan la 'god par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The mountain-like perfection of meditation of the Thought of Enlightenment is to be learned by the Mother, by one who desires to establish the distracted in meditation.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @208a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa @208a * //
translated: That perfection of meditation is like a mountain because it cannot be moved by distraction.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pas mi sgul bas ri rab lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pas mi sgul bas ri rab lta bu'o //
translated: It is like Mount Meru, since it cannot be shaken by signs or signlessness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sman bzang po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni shes rab 'chal ba rnams shes rab la 'god par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi shes rab zil gyis mnan par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sman bzang po lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni shes rab 'chal ba rnams shes rab la 'god par 'dod pa dang / nyan thos dang rang rgyal gyi shes rab zil gyis mnan par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The thought of awakening, which is the excellent medicine of the perfection of wisdom, should be trained in by those who wish to establish those with poor wisdom in wisdom, and by those who wish to overpower the wisdom of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas sman lta bu'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad zhi bar byed pas sman lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like medicine, since it pacifies all the sicknesses of the afflictions.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug thabs mkhas pas chung du yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug thabs mkhas pas chung du yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi zad par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The thought of awakening, which is the spiritual friend of the perfection of skillful means, should be trained in by those who wish to skillfully increase the six perfections, even if they are small, up to the knowledge of all aspects.

analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dgos 'dod thams cad 'byung bas rin po che lta bu'o //

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pas nyi ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pas nyi ma lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of power is like the sun, for it ripens the harvest of those to be trained.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glu dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems skyed pa gcig gis 'dod zhing yon tan brjod pa dang / sgra dbyangs gcig gis go bar 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa glu dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems skyed pa gcig gis 'dod zhing yon tan brjod pa dang / sgra dbyangs gcig gis go bar 'dod pa dang /
translated: The perfection of intuitive wisdom is like a sweet song, for it is the spirit of enlightenment that is desired in the ten directions by a single thought, and is desired to be understood by a single sound.

original: stong pa bco brgyad shes par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa bco brgyad shes par 'dod pa dang / de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid khong du chud par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: It is desired to be known in the eighteen emptinesses, and it is desired to be understood as the reality nature of all phenomena such as emptiness.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdul bya rnams kyi dang ba 'dren par byed pa'i dri za'i glu dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gdul bya rnams kyi dang ba 'dren par byed pa'i dri za'i glu dbyangs snyan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The perfection of intuitive wisdom is like a sweet song of the gandharvas, for it attracts the interest of those to be trained.

original: mngon par shes pa rgyal po lta bu'i byang @208b chub kyi sems ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams shes par 'dod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rgyal po lta bu'i byang @208b chub kyi sems ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams shes par 'dod /
translated: The bodhicitta that is like a king of superknowledges is the desire to know the worlds of the great trichiliocosm.

original: chu thams cad sgra'i nyag ma gcig gis blang bar 'dod /üîΩme'i phung po thams cad zhi bar 'dod //
analyzed: chu thams cad sgra'i nyag ma gcig gis blang bar 'dod / me'i phung po thams cad zhi bar 'dod //
translated: The desire to take up all waters with a single drop.üîΩThe desire to extinguish all masses of fire.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad zhi bar 'dod /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad zhi bar 'dod /
translated: The desire to extinguish all ma·πá·∏çalas of wind.

original: skyil mo krung gcig gis khengs par 'dod /
analyzed: skyil mo krung gcig gis khengs par 'dod /
translated: The desire to fill with a single cross-legged posture.üîΩThe desire to cover other realms with a single hair.

original: skra nyag ma gcig gis sbams nas gzhan du 'phang bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: skra nyag ma gcig gis sbams nas gzhan du 'phang bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the mother.

original: mngon par shes pa dbang 'byor pa thob par 'dod pas 'di la mi mos par mi bya ste rgyal po dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dbang 'byor pa thob par 'dod pas 'di la mi mos par mi bya ste rgyal po dang 'dra'o //
translated: One who desires to attain the mastery of superknowledges should not be uninterested in this, like a king.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bod mdzod lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bod mdzod lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na /
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment, which is like a treasury of the collections of merit and of cognition, is the one which is to be desired by all the Blessed Buddhas, together with their retinues of Bodhisattvas and their communities of Sravakas, however many there may be, in the world systems of the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges River, with a single gift of alms and with a single offering of flowers, incense, etc.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad bsod snyoms gcig dang / me tog dang spos la sogs pa gcig gis khyed par 'dod pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phung po lnga la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang bcas nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad bsod snyoms gcig dang / me tog dang spos la sogs pa gcig gis khyed par 'dod pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phung po lnga la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: It is to be desired by those who wish to establish the unequalled five aggregates,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and by those who wish to establish the stream-enterers, etc.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pas bang mdzod lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zad mi shes pas bang mdzod lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a treasury, because of the inexhaustibility of the collections of merit and of cognition.

original: lam po che lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan shes par 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pa dang dge ba la sogs pa dmigs pa bcu gcig gi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lam po che lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan shes par 'dod pa dang / thob par 'dod pa dang dge ba la sogs pa dmigs pa bcu gcig gi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mind that is like a highway is for those who wish to know the qualities of all the buddhas of the three times, and who wish to attain them, and who wish to perfect the eleven topics such as virtue. They should train in the Mother.

original: byang chub kyi sems dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su gshegs pas lam po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su gshegs pas lam po che lta bu'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mind that is like a highway is the path followed by all the tathƒÅgatas of the three times.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nang gi 'khor du 'gyur bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nang gi 'khor du 'gyur bar 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mind that is like a vehicle, endowed with ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, is for those who wish to precede all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and who wish to become an inner retinue of the tathƒÅgatas. They should train in the Mother.

analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa ni gang du'ang mi ltung bar 'gro bas bzhon pa glang po che lta bu'o //
translated: Endowed with ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ, one goes without falling anywhere, like an elephant vehicle.

original: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis @209a * //
analyzed: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis @209a * //
translated: The Thought of Enlightenment endowed with the retention Dharanis and the analytical knowledges is like the water of a fountain, because it is the cause of the endless and uninterrupted teaching of the Dharma.

original: gsungs pa dang / gsung ba dang gsung bar 'gyur pa thams cad shes pa dang mi brjed par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa dang / gsung ba dang gsung bar 'gyur pa thams cad shes pa dang mi brjed par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One who is endowed with the retention Dharanis and the analytical knowledges should train in the Mother Perfection of Wisdom if he wishes to know and not forget all the teachings of the twelve branches of the scriptures of the Buddhas in the ten directions, as many as there are sands in the Ganges River, which have been taught, are being taught, and will be taught.

original: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa ni rung zhing mi zad pas na bkod ma'i chu lta bu'o //üîΩsgra snyan ba lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na /
analyzed: gzungs dang so so yang dag par rig pa dang ldan pa ni rung zhing mi zad pas na bkod ma'i chu lta bu'o //üîΩsgra snyan ba lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed na /
translated: The retention Dharanis and the analytical knowledges are like the water of a fountain, because they are suitable and inexhaustible.üîΩThe Thought of Enlightenment like a sweet sounding voice is like the water of a fountain, because it is the cause of the endless and uninterrupted teaching of the Dharma.

original: mun pa mun nag smag gis khyab pa thams cad bsal bar 'dod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi sgra bsgrag par 'dod pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god par 'dod pa dang / brtson ra dang khri mon na 'khod pa thams cad bdag gi mthus rang dgar spyad par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa mun nag smag gis khyab pa thams cad bsal bar 'dod pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi sgra bsgrag par 'dod pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la 'god par 'dod pa dang / brtson ra dang khri mon na 'khod pa thams cad bdag gi mthus rang dgar spyad par 'dod pas yum la bslab par bya'o //
translated: One should train in the Mother in order to dispel all the darkness of the world, in order to proclaim the sound of the Three Jewels, in order to establish all beings in the right view, and in order to liberate all those who are imprisoned or bound in slavery by one‚Äôs own power.
